The prism is centered on a white background. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** Use the following parameters for the coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. **Generate the 2D sketch** Generate a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 2.1. **Create Faces** - Face 1: A rectangle - Face 2: A rectangle 2.2. **Create Loops** Face 1: - Loop 1: A closed loop enclosing the rectangle. Face 2: - Loop 1: A closed loop enclosing the rectangle. 2.3. **Create Curves** Face 1, Loop 1: - Curve 1: Line joining the points [0.0, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.0] - Curve 2: Line joining the points [0.75, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.75] - Curve 3: Line joining the points [0.75, 0.75] and [0.0, 0.75] - Curve 4: Line joining the points [0.0, 0.75] and [0.0, 0.0] Face 2, Loop 1: - Curve 1: Line joining the points [0.0, 0.0] and [1.0, 0.0] - Curve 2: Line joining the points [1.0, 0.0] and [1.0, 1.0] - Curve 3: Line joining the points [1.0, 1.0] and [0.0, 1.0] - Curve 4: Line joining the points [0.0, 1.0] and [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Apply the following transformation: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 45.0] (0.0 degrees on the X-axis, Y-axis, and a 45-degree rotation around the Z-axis) - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] (No translation) 4. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.285 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body. After completing these steps, Part 1 should have the specified shape with a width of 0.75, a length of 0.75, and a height of 0.285. This part will become the base for subsequent parts.</description>

The 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' boolean operation should be used to combine the extrusion with any existing bodies. The final dimensions of this part are: - Length: 0.5 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.75</description>

Each sketch can contain multiple faces, and each face can contain multiple loops. In this case, there is only one face, and it contains one loop. The loop consists of four lines, which are joined end-to-end to form a closed loop. Loops are always closed, and they can consist of multiple lines and/or arcs. However, they cannot consist of a line and a circle or an arc and a circle. The extrusion properties are as follows: extrude_depth_towards_normal = 0.75, extrude_depth_opposite_normal = 0.0, sketch_scale = 0.75, and the boolean operation for this part is to create a new solid body. The final CAD model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length and width are both 0.75 units, and the height is 0.75 units. prompt: <description>**Intermediate CAD Part 1 - A Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Cutout** The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces. This part is constructed as follows: 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** The euler angles are set to 0 degrees for all axes and the translation vector is set to the origin. coordinate\\_system : Euler Angles : [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Translation Vector : [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. **Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane.** This sketch will define the profile of the prism. sketch : face\\_1 : loop\\_1 : line\\_1 : Start Point : [0.0, 0.0] End Point : [0.75, 0.0] line\\_2 : Start Point : [0.75, 0.0] End Point : [0.75, 0.75] line\\_3 : Start Point : [0.75, 0.75] End Point : [0.0, 0.75] line\\_4 : Start Point : [0.0, 0.75] End Point : [0.0, 0.0] The sketch contains one face and one loop. The loop consists of four lines, forming a closed shape. The width of the prism is 0.75 units and the height is 0.75 units. 3. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** This is done by applying a 3D rotation using the euler angles, followed by a translation vector. In this case, the rotation is unnecessary since the euler angles are all 0 degrees. transformation : euler\\_angles : [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] translation\\_vector : [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 4. **Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model.** The cutout is achieved by extruding only a portion of the sketch. extrusion : extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal : 0.0937 extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal : 0.0 sketch\\_scale : 0.75 operation : JoinFeatureOperation After completing these steps, we have a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces. **Intermediate CAD Part 2 - A CAD Model with Two Rectangular Prisms** The second part of the CAD assembly is a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular prism inside it, both sharing the same center. This part is constructed as follows: 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** The euler angles are set to 0 for the X and Y axes and -90 degrees for the Z axis. The translation vector is set to the coordinates of the first rectangular prism. coordinate\\_system : Euler Angles : [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] Translation Vector : [0.6, 0.375, 0.0937] 2. **Create two 2D sketches on the XY and YZ planes.** These sketches will define the profiles of the rectangular prisms. sketch : face\\_1 : loop\\_1 : line\\_1 : Start Point : [0.0, 0.0] End Point : [0.0375, 0.0] line\\_2 : Start Point : [0.0375, 0.0] End Point : [0.0375, 0.0375] line\\_3 : Start Point : [0.0375, 0.0375] End Point : [0.0, 0.0375] line\\_4 : Start Point : [0.0, 0.0375] End Point : [0.0, 0.0] face\\_2 : loop\\_1 : line\\_1 : Start Point : [0.075, 0.0] End Point : [0.1125, 0.0] line\\_2 : Start Point : [0.1125 ```</description>
